page.title: 10Comparing two Estates (cont)
page.content:
On the outer city council estate the Socio-Economic structure was different. 70% of those employed were engaged in semi-skilled or unskilled occupations. 21% were unemployed. 96% rented their home from Wakefield M.D.C., none had central heating but 100% had hot water, bath, W.C., cooker, fridge, T.V., washer and vacuum cleaner. Only 36% owned a car, 28% a garage, 26% a video recorder, 12% a micro-wave oven and 58% owned a freezer.
{A HIGHER STANDARD OF LIVING IN TERMS {OF MATERIAL WEALTH EXISTED ON THE {THORNES MOOR ROAD ESTATE.
